required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Estrogen and Gender Biased Autoimmunity in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

lead_sponsor.agency: The Center for Rheumatic Disease, Allergy, & Immunology

clinical_study.source: The Center for Rheumatic Disease, Allergy, & Immunology

brief_summary.textblock: This study involves research to investigate how estrogen affects women of childbearing age and its correlation to Systemic Lupus Erythematosus. The findings from this study might help determine how body cells, called T Cells, react to estrogen. The study will seek to determine if cells from women with Lupus, react differently from cells in persons without Lupus. We will attempt to identify genetic factors that determine the effects of estrogen on Lupus cells.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a 3-year study. The total number of subjects enrolled will depend on the results obtained. The subjects will be at least 18 years of age and pre-menopausal. Exclusion to include pregnant women, and all subjects are told not to get pregnant while on study. Also, they cannot take hormones by mouth or patch while on study. The study can include healthy subjects as well. Blood will be drawn (120 ml) four times a year, randomly.

arm_group.description: Females who are still childbearing age, not on hormones, with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus, still cycling.

intervention.description: 100ml blood for analysis, taken no more than 4 times in one year.

study_pop.textblock: Female subjects with SLE and still cycling, not on hormones, compared to normal controls, female subjects still cycling, also not on hormones and not diagnosed with SLE.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female subjects with Lupus, and female subjects without Lupus. age at least 18, not pregnant and not planning to get pregnant.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or planning to get pregnant. On hormone replacement, or birth control of any kind.

overall_official.affiliation: The Center for Rheumatic Disease, Allergy and Immunology

facility.name: The Center for Rheumatic Disease, Allergy and Immunology

responsible_party.organization: Center for Rheumatic Disease Allergy & Immunology
